verses.verse: I said <WH559> in my heart <WH3820>, Come now <WH3212>, I will prove <WH5254> thee with mirth <WH8057>; therefore enjoy <WH7200> pleasure <WH2896>: and <WH1892>, behold, this also was vanity.
I said <WH559> of laughter <WH7814>, It is mad <WH1984>; and of mirth <WH8057>, What <WH2090> doeth it <WH6213>?

I searched <WH8446> in my heart <WH3820> how to cheer <WH4900> my <WH1320> flesh with wine <WH3196>, my heart <WH3820> yet guiding <WH5090> me with wisdom <WH2451>, and how to lay hold <WH270> on folly <WH5531>, till I might see <WH7200> what it was good <WH2896> for the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> that they should do <WH6213> under heaven <WH8064> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of their life <WH2416>.
I made me great <WH1431> works <WH4639>; I builded <WH1129> me houses <WH1004>; I planted <WH5193> me vineyards <WH3754>;
I made <WH6213> me gardens <WH1593> and parks <WH6508>, and I planted <WH5193> trees <WH6086> in them of all kinds of fruit <WH6529>;
I made <WH6213> me pools <WH1295> of water <WH4325>, to water <WH8248> therefrom the forest <WH3293> where trees <WH3293> were reared <WH6779>;

I bought <WH7069> men-servants <WH5650> and maid-servants <WH8198>, and had servants born <WH1121> in my house <WH1004>; also I had great <WH7235> possessions <WH4735> of herds <WH6629> and flocks <WH1241>, above all that were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem <WH3389>;

I gathered <WH3664> me also silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091>, and the treasure <WH5459> of kings <WH4428> and of the provinces <WH4082>; I gat <WH6213> me men-singers <WH7891> and women-singers <WH7891>, and the delights <WH8588> of the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>, musical instruments <WH7705>, and that of all sorts.
So I was great <WH1431>, and increased <WH3254> more than all that were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem <WH3389>: also my wisdom <WH2451> remained with me <WH5975>.

And whatsoever mine eyes <WH5869> desired <WH7592> I kept <WH680> not from them <WH4513>; I withheld not my heart <WH3820> from any joy <WH8057>; for my heart <WH3820> rejoiced <WH8056> because of all my labor <WH5999>; and this was my portion <WH2506> from all my labor <WH5999>.

Then I looked <WH6437> on all the works <WH4639> that my hands <WH3027> had wrought <WH6213>, and on the labor <WH5999> that I had labored <WH5999> to do <WH6213>; and <WH1892>, behold, all was vanity and a striving <WH7469> after wind <WH7307>, and there was no profit <WH3504> under the sun <WH8121>.

And I turned <WH6437> myself to behold <WH7200> wisdom <WH2451>, and madness <WH1947>, and folly <WH5531>: for what can the man <WH120> do that cometh <WH935> after <WH310> the king <WH4428>? even that which hath been done <WH6213> long ago <WH3528>.
Then I saw <WH7200> that <WH3426> wisdom <WH2451> excelleth <WH3504> folly <WH5531>, as far as light <WH216> excelleth <WH3504> darkness <WH2822>.

The wise man <WH2450>'s eyes <WH5869> are in his head <WH7218>, and the fool <WH3684> walketh <WH1980> in darkness <WH2822>: and yet I perceived <WH3045> that one <WH259> event <WH4745> happeneth to them all <WH7136>.

Then <WH227> said <WH559> I in my heart <WH3820>, As it happeneth <WH4745> to the fool <WH3684>, so will it happen <WH7136> even to me <WH1571>; and why was I then more <WH3148> wise <WH2449>? Then said <WH1696> I in my heart <WH3820>, that this also is vanity <WH1892>.

For of the wise <WH2450> man <WH5973>, even as of the fool <WH3684>, there is no remembrance <WH2146> for ever <WH5769>; seeing <WH3528> that in the days <WH3117> to come <WH935> all will have been long forgotten <WH7911>. And how doth the wise <WH2450> man die <WH4191> even as the fool <WH3684>!

So I hated <WH8130> life <WH2416>, because the work <WH4639> that is wrought <WH6213> under the sun <WH8121> was grievous <WH7451> unto me <WH1892>; for all is vanity and a striving <WH7469> after wind <WH7307>.
And I hated <WH8130> all my labor <WH5999> wherein I labored <WH5999> under the sun <WH8121>, seeing that I must leave <WH3240> it unto the man <WH120> that shall be after me <WH310>.

And who knoweth <WH3045> whether he will be a wise <WH2450> man or a fool <WH5530>? yet will he have rule <WH7980> over all my labor <WH5999> wherein I have labored <WH5999>, and wherein I have showed myself wise <WH2449> under the sun <WH8121>. This also is vanity <WH1892>.
Therefore I turned about <WH5437> to cause <WH2976> my heart <WH3820> to despair <WH2976> concerning all the labor <WH5999> wherein I had labored <WH5999> under the sun <WH8121>.

For there is <WH3426> a man <WH120> whose labor <WH5999> is with wisdom <WH2451>, and with knowledge <WH1847>, and with skilfulness <WH3788>; yet to a man <WH120> that hath not labored <WH5998> therein shall he leave <WH5414> it for his portion <WH2506>. This also is vanity <WH1892> and a great <WH7227> evil <WH7451>.
For what hath <WH1933> a man <WH120> of all his labor <WH5999>, and of the striving <WH7475> of his heart <WH3820>, wherein <WH1931> he laboreth <WH6001> under the sun <WH8121>?

For all his days <WH3117> are but sorrows <WH4341>, and his travail <WH6045> is grief <WH3708>; yea <WH3915>, even in the night his heart <WH3820> taketh no rest <WH7901>. This also is vanity <WH1892>.

There is nothing better <WH2896> for a man <WH120> than that he should eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>, and make his soul <WH5315> enjoy <WH7200> good <WH2896> in his labor <WH5999>. This <WH2090> also I saw <WH7200>, that it is from the hand <WH3027> of God <WH430>.
For who can eat <WH398>, or who can have enjoyment <WH2363>, more than I <WH2351>?

For to the man <WH120> that pleaseth <WH2896> him <WH6440> God giveth <WH5414> wisdom <WH2451>, and knowledge <WH1847>, and joy <WH8057>; but to the sinner <WH2398> he giveth <WH5414> travail <WH6045>, to gather <WH622> and to heap up <WH3664>, that he may give <WH5414> to him that <WH6440> pleaseth <WH2896> God <WH430>. This also is vanity <WH1892> and a striving <WH7469> after wind <WH7307>.
